result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan Arthur Otte

records.addlTxt: For failure to appear10/10/2022 for return date

10:34 AM Defendant Bryan Arthur Otte not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Margeret Anne Sorrentino in court for the State of Wisconsin. State requested warrant based on failure to appear. Court authorized warrant. 10:35 AM

Pre- trial 9/30/22 at 9:30 AM
Return date 10/10/22 at 10:00 AM

Standard felony conditions, not leave the State of WI without written permission of the court, immediately report to the Columbia county jail for fingerprinting and photographing, Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia.

1:45 PM Defendant Bryan Arthur Otte appeared by video in custody from Columbia County jail.  Attorney Gibson D Hatch appeared by video for Bryan Arthur Otte.  Prosecuting attorney Margeret Anne Sorrentino in court for the State of Wisconsin. right to attorney recited, reading of complaint waived, $1,000.00 cash bond, Standard felony conditions, Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. waived time limits, 2:24 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Return date scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
